source.49d411e3:
import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.6525de15:
anos=df["ANO"]
x=np.unique(anos)
estados=np.unique(df["ESTADO"])
df['PREÇO MÉDIO DISTRIBUIÇÃO']=df['PREÇO MÉDIO DISTRIBUIÇÃO'].replace('-',1.929)
print(np.unique(df["PRODUTO"]))
source.d46dc7b6:
for estado in estados:
    total,total2,total3=[],[],[]
    for ano in x:
        parcial=df.loc[(df['ESTADO']==estado) & (df["PRODUTO"]=="ETANOL HIDRATADO") & (df['ANO']==ano) ]
        z=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO REVENDA'])))
        z2=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO DISTRIBUIÇÃO'])))
        z=z.astype(np.float)
        z2=z2.astype(np.float)
        z3=z-z2 # calculating the average margin between sale and  
        total.append(np.mean(z))
        total2.append(np.mean(z2))
        total3.append(np.mean(z3))
    plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
    plt.title(estado + ' years average ETHANOL Prices')
    plt.plot(x,total,label=' price of resale')
    plt.plot(x,total2,label='price of distribution')
    plt.ylabel("R$/L")
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
    plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
    plt.title(estado + ' average margin for Ethanol sales')
    plt.plot(x,total3, label ='margin for Ethanol sales')
    plt.ylabel('R$/L')
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()

for estado in estados:
    total,total2,total3=[],[],[]
    for ano in x:
        parcial=df.loc[(df['ESTADO']==estado) & (df["PRODUTO"]=="ÓLEO DIESEL") & (df['ANO']==ano) ]
        z=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO REVENDA'])))
        z2=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO DISTRIBUIÇÃO'])))
        z=z.astype(np.float)
        z2=z2.astype(np.float)
        z3= z-z2
        total.append(np.mean(z))
        total2.append(np.mean(z2))
        total3.append(np.mean(z3))
    plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
    plt.title(estado + ' year average DIESEL Prices')
    plt.plot(x,total,label=' price of resale')
    plt.plot(x,total2,label='price of distribution')
    plt.ylabel("R$/l")
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
    plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
    plt.title(estado + ' year average margin for Diesel prices sales')
    plt.plot(x,total3,label = 'margin')
    plt.ylabel('R$/L')
    plt.legend()
    plt.show()
source.2ad030ac:
regioes=np.unique(df["REGIÃO"])
regi,regi2=[],[]
for regiao in regioes:
    total,total2=[],[]
    for ano in x:
        parcial=df.loc[(df['REGIÃO']==regiao) & (df["PRODUTO"]=="ETANOL HIDRATADO") & (df['ANO']==ano) ]
        z=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO REVENDA'])))
        z2=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO DISTRIBUIÇÃO'])))
        z=z.astype(np.float)
        z2=z2.astype(np.float)
        total.append(np.mean(z))
        total2.append(np.mean(z2))
    regi.append(total)
    regi2.append(total2)
plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
plt.title('Average prices ETHANOL per region')
for r in range(len(regi)):
    plt.plot(x,regi[r],label=' price of resale '+ regioes[r])
    plt.plot(x,regi[r],label='price of distribution '+ regioes[r])
plt.ylabel("R$/l")
plt.legend()
plt.show()

source.bc6a9855:
regioes=np.unique(df["REGIÃO"])
regi,regi2=[],[]
for regiao in regioes:
    total,total2=[],[]
    for ano in x:
        parcial=df.loc[(df['REGIÃO']==regiao) & (df["PRODUTO"]=="ÓLEO DIESEL") & (df['ANO']==ano) ]
        z=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO REVENDA'])))
        z2=(np.array(list(parcial['PREÇO MÉDIO DISTRIBUIÇÃO'])))
        z=z.astype(np.float)
        z2=z2.astype(np.float)
        total.append(np.mean(z))
        total2.append(np.mean(z2))
    regi.append(total)
    regi2.append(total2)
plt.figure(figsize=(12,6))
plt.title('Average prices of DIESEL per region')
for r in range(len(regi)):
    plt.plot(x,regi[r],label=' price of resale '+ regioes[r])
    plt.plot(x,regi[r],label='price of distribution '+ regioes[r])
plt.ylabel("R$/l")
plt.legend()
plt.show()
source.3b301ed8: # Plotting the year average of the resale and distribution prices of each state in relation to time
source.c9686a13: As we can see the etanol prices are higher in the north region of Brazil, this can be explained by a number of reasons but mostly by the great difficulty of reaching those regions.
source.58ec5b35: It was used the value 1.929 to replace the resale price because this is the average sale value of the ethanol
source.ab4df441:
Now in the gas price distribution the difference between the lower and greater average price is not as big as the ethanol distribution.
Now it is time to look at the diesel distribution by region
source.19067a85: In Brazil we can see that diesel prices and all the other fuels are increasing in price and that fuels as diesel and gas are not difering so mch from a region to another when compared to ethanol.
